sailpoint.api
Class Provisioner

java.lang.Object
  sailpoint.api.Provisioner

public class Provisioner
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class to process ProvisioningProjects and ProvisioningPlans.

Field Detail

ARG_DETECTED_ROLE_RECONCILIATION

public static final java.lang.String ARG_DETECTED_ROLE_RECONCILIATION
A special option recognized by the role reconciliation methods. It will cause all currently detected roles to be removed and they will only be retained if there is an assignment that requires or permits them.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ARG_RESET_PERMITTED_ROLES

public static final java.lang.String ARG_RESET_PERMITTED_ROLES
A special option recognized by the role reconciliation methods. It will cause all detected roles that are permitted by the current assignments to be removed. They will be retained only if there is an assignment that requires them.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ARG_FULL_RECONCILIATION

public static final java.lang.String ARG_FULL_RECONCILIATION
A special option recognized by the role reconciliation methods. It will cause all entitlements to be removed from the Identity and will only retain them if they are required by the assigned roles. Essentially this brings the Identity into strict compliance with the assignment model. Yes, it is very dangerous.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ARG_PROVISION_ROLES_IF_CHANGED

public static final java.lang.String ARG_PROVISION_ROLES_IF_CHANGED
A special option reconciled by the role reconciliation methods. It will cause role reconciliation requests to be added to the project only if there was at least one change to the assignment list. This was used for a brief period of time to make the refresh task not generate duplicate work items or trouble tickets each time the task ran if the assignments had not changed since the last run. Bug 6063. This became largely obsolete with the addition of ProvisioningRequests, but it can still occasionally be used as a performance optimization.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ARG_OPTIMIZE_RECONCILIATION

public static final java.lang.String ARG_OPTIMIZE_RECONCILIATION
A special option recognized by the role reconciliation methods. It enables an optimization where a role assignment will not be added to the reconciliation project if it is not new. The effect is similar to provisionRolesIfChanged but more selective. This option is recommended to improve performance in identity refresh tasks where entitlement correlation is enabled but provisioning is not enabled Since now the Provisioner is used to update target memory, it is faster to only use it for new assignments, old assignments can reuse their old targets.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ARG_NAMES

public static final java.lang.String[] ARG_NAMES
The names of all Provisioner arguments.

RET_ASSIGNMENTS_RECONCILED

public static final java.lang.String RET_ASSIGNMENTS_RECONCILED
Number of role assignments that have been reconciled in reconcileAutoAssignments.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

compile

public ProvisioningProject compile(ProvisioningPlan masterPlan,
                                   Attributes<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> scriptArgs)
                            throws GeneralException
Compile a master plan into a project. This is the newer method that is recommended for new code.

The Identity is passed in the plan.

If you want ARG_NO_FILTERING or any other option you must use the constructor that takes an args map or call setArgument before compilation.

The arguments map is optional and typically set only when Provisioner is being used from within a workflow. This allows the workflow to pass in state that can be used in Template and Field scripts. This might be the same as the arg map passed to the constructor but do not assume so, it might have more and different things.

Throws:
GeneralException

public ProvisioningProject compile(ProvisioningPlan masterPlan)
                            throws GeneralException
Compile the plan into a project without any special script arguments.

GeneralException

recompile

public ProvisioningProject recompile(ProvisioningProject project,
                                     Attributes<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> scriptArgs)
                              throws GeneralException
Recompile a previously compiled project, factoring in the results of answered Questions. If the returned project has more Questions they must be answered before the project can be executed.

Throws:
GeneralException

compileOld

@Deprecated
public ProvisioningProject compileOld(Identity identity,
                                                 ProvisioningPlan masterPlan,
                                                 boolean forceAll)
                               throws GeneralException
Deprecated. Use Provisioner.compile(ProvisioningPlan, Attributes).

Older compilation interface used by RemediationManager and possibly others. Identity was passed as an argument and the "forceAll" flag could be used to disable filtering.

Try to weed this out and use the newer interfaces with more explicit arg passing.

Throws:
GeneralException

compile

@Deprecated
public ProvisioningProject compile(Identity identity,
                                              ProvisioningPlan masterPlan,
                                              boolean forceAll)
                            throws GeneralException
Deprecated. Use Provisioner.compile(ProvisioningPlan, Attributes)

Original interface provided for customization backward compatibility. Try not to use this in new code.

Throws:
GeneralException

reconcile

reconcileManualAssignments

public ProvisioningProject reconcileManualAssignments(Identity ident,
                                                      java.util.List<Bundle> newRoles,
                                                      Attributes<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> scriptArgs)
                                               throws GeneralException
Compile a project that will bring the given identity into alignment with a set of new assignments specified as a Bundle list. This is for backward compatibility with the unit tests, and possibly some custom code that thinks of assignments as a List of Bundle objects without duplicates. The passed list is authoritative and the RoleAssignment list is synced with it.

Throws:
GeneralException

reconcileUnitTestRoles

@Deprecated
public ProvisioningProject reconcileUnitTestRoles(Identity ident,
                                                             java.util.List<Bundle> roles,
                                                             Attributes<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> scriptArgs)
                                           throws GeneralException
Deprecated. Use Provisioner.reconcileManualAssignments(Identity, List, Attributes)

Throws:
GeneralException

reconcileAutoAssignments

public ProvisioningProject reconcileAutoAssignments(Identity ident,
                                                    java.util.List<RoleAssignment> newAssignments,
                                                    Attributes<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> scriptArgs)
                                             throws GeneralException
Compile a project that will bring the given identity into alignment with a list of rule-based assignments calculated by the EntitlementCorrelator. This is now the primary interface between Identitizer and Provisioner.

This is intended for use only by Identitizer to provision the list of rule-based assignments from the EntitlementCorrelator.

The new assignment list is expected to contain both the rule-based assignments and any manual assignments we carried over. In other words, it can be directly assigned to the Identity replacing the old assignment list.

Note that this can may also add attribute assignments and attribute synchronization requests to the project unless disabled.

Throws:
GeneralException

getProject

public ProvisioningProject getProject()
Return the result of the last compilation.

getUnmanagedPlan

public ProvisioningPlan getUnmanagedPlan()
Return the unmanaged plan after compilation.

getUnmanagedPlan

public ProvisioningPlan getUnmanagedPlan(java.lang.String trackingId)
Return an unmanaged itemized plan with a given tracking id. This can only be called after itemization. These are derived from the unmanaged plan so they will not be associated with an IntegrationExecutor.

This return a copy that can be modified by the caller.

GeneralException

itemize

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,ProvisioningPlan> itemize(boolean simplifyItems)
                                                         throws GeneralException
Build a list of ProvisioningPlan slices for each unique tracking id found in the compiled plans. If specified each itemized plan will be simplified individually.

Parameters:
simplifyItems - True if the plans should be simplified before being itemized
Returns:
The itemized plans after itemization
Throws:
GeneralException

getItemizedPlans

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,ProvisioningPlan> getItemizedPlans()
Return the itemized plans after itemization. The map is keyed by tracking id and the plans contain only those items associated with that id.

getItemizedPlan

public ProvisioningPlan getItemizedPlan(java.lang.String key)
Return a managed itemized plan with a given tracking id. This can only be called after itemization. These are derived from the managed plan list so they will have been associated with an IntegrationExecutor.

This return a copy that can be modified by the caller.

simplify

public void simplify()
              throws GeneralException
Interface to run simplification without evaluation. Normally simplification is deferred until execute() but some of the unit tests want to see the results of simplification without evaluating anything.

Throws:
GeneralException

execute

public void execute()
             throws GeneralException
Execute the managed plans after compilation. This is an older interface that expects compilation and evaluation to be done immediately after each other with state carried in one instance of Provisioner. compile() must already have been called.

Throws:
GeneralException

execute

public void execute(ProvisioningProject project)
             throws GeneralException
Execute a previously compiled project. The Provisioner object that compiled the project can be different than the that is now executing it.

Note that provisioning options come exclusively from the project, whatever is in the _arguments map is ignored. The map is normally empty if you are calling this method. This ensures that the project is evaluated with the options it was compiled with.

Throws:
GeneralException

public void execute(ProvisioningPlan masterPlan)
             throws GeneralException
Compile and execute a plan in one call.

Throws:
GeneralException

impactAnalysis

public void impactAnalysis(Identity ident)
                    throws GeneralException
Simulate a full reconciliation of an identity's current role assignments. This is used for impact analysis. The Identity passed in here will be modified, it is best if the caller passes in a detached skeleton.

Throws:
GeneralException

                           ProvisioningPlan plan)
                    throws GeneralException
Do impact analysis from a plan.

Throws:
GeneralException

impactAnalysis

public void impactAnalysis(Identity ident,
                           ProvisioningProject project)
                    throws GeneralException
Do impact analysis on a previously compiled project. We need to temporarily override the project options for simulation and optimistic provisioning.

Throws:
GeneralException
